Get the "source" for relative risk flows

get_relative_risk_source.Rd

Function to extract relative risk information from a nested list structure. It returns the filename and the source of the relative risk. The source is extracted from the file name when extract is TRUE, and otherwise from the item containing the relative risk information.

Usage

get_relative_risk_source(input_list, lookup_items, extract = TRUE)

Arguments

input_list

A nested list containing relative risk information.

lookup_items

A character vector of items to look up within each sublist.

extract

Logical. If TRUE (default), extracts the source of relative risks, by calling extract_relative_risk_source. If FALSE, returns the name of the item containing the relative risk.

Value

A nested list structure containing the extracted information or item names at the leaf nodes. If an empty directory is the leaf node, its value is an empty list.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
groups <- get_file_groups("../data/Tutorial_Data/Reference_Data")
keywords_disease <- c("Relative_Risks_From_Risk_Factor", "Relative_Risks_From_Diseases")
keywords_rf <- c("Relative_Risks_For_Death", "Relative_Risks_For_Disability")
get_relative_risk_source(groups$diseases, keywords_disease)
get_relative_risk_source(groups$risk_factors, keywords_rf, FALSE)
} # }
